intro: Lasianthus lucidus var. caudisepalus, commonly known as the long-sepaled lasianthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The varietal name "caudisepalus" refers to its elongated sepals, which are a distinguishing feature of this variant.
